content.subtitle: Honesty is an important factor in the interview process and it’s often hard to gauge. Connecting weaknesses with emotional intelligence is…

paragraphs.text: What a great read! Thank you for your perspective.

paragraphs.name: 459d
paragraphs.text: Honesty is an important factor in the interview process and it’s often hard to gauge. Connecting weaknesses with emotional intelligence is a unique point of view.

paragraphs.name: f476
paragraphs.text: Great article, Karla. A lot of the CEOs we interview talk about the importance of EQ in the workplace. You’ve presented some helpful information.

paragraphs.name: 41aa
paragraphs.text: Nice work Karla

91db048d36a4.title: Very well written and great questions and points made! Helpful read! Thanks!!!

paragraphs.name: d41e
paragraphs.text: Very well written and great questions and points made! Helpful read! Thanks!!!

Great article Karla Cook. The emotional intelligence or Emotional IQ of a future employee is such an important aspect to consider during the interview process. With today’s high standards in formal education every second person appears to look good on paper but how they are in the workplace shows how they can really contribute to a team. This is an excellent guide!

paragraphs.name: 790a
paragraphs.text: Thanks Karla for the sharing! I have previously outlined an ideal colleague or employee to be someone who “exercises care, respect and kindness in speech and thought”. I realized it is more elegant to relabel the attribute as “emotional intelligence” and the “tell me more about” questions that you have provided are very actionable! Thank you! (:

paragraphs.name: f8db
paragraphs.text: This is stellar. Nice work!

7afb7ecb77df.title: These are the types of questions that should be asked both for fit & long-term success

paragraphs.name: b674
paragraphs.text: These are the types of questions that should be asked both for fit & long-term success
This is so important! Emotional intelligence needs to be taken into account more often in the hiring process. Collaborative hiring can help get to the bottom of a candidate’s personality! Read more:

62b55bef358f.title: It’s also important to remember that an interview is an emotionally threatening situation.

paragraphs.text: It’s also important to remember that an interview is an emotionally threatening situation. Working with ways to make the interview itself safe will improve the quality of answers to questions like these. Being conversational instead of confrontational, for example…

aa5f263e1185.title: I’ve been a fan of using emotional intelligence in hiring for a long time, but this article from…

paragraphs.name: bf79
paragraphs.text: I’ve been a fan of using emotional intelligence in hiring for a long time, but this article from Adam Grant — one of the foremost experts in organizational psychology — has driven me to rethink it: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/20140930125543-69244073-emotional-intelligence-is-overrated

paragraphs.text: Thanks Karla

paragraphs.name: 0cb4
paragraphs.text: I am currently in the job hunting process and believe that one of my skills or traits is emotional intelligence and self-awareness. However, on one or two of these questions, I was stumped a little. This serves as a learning curve and a chance to improve going into job interviews!

5b4d1729df82.title: Excellent article and very good questions. Tough, but good. Thanks!

paragraphs.text: Excellent article and very good questions. Tough, but good. Thanks!

91e3bd2bc5ca.title: The result of the “ME” driven society is many if not most have been programmed (parents, commercial…

paragraphs.name: d634
paragraphs.text: The result of the “ME” driven society is many if not most have been programmed (parents, commercial advertising, media) to believe THEY are always right, therefore it must always be someone else’s fault. Participation trophies & safe spaces. Great article.

220070d052b1.title: Loving the insight on this topic and even more, in this particular context.

paragraphs.text: Loving the insight on this topic and even more, in this particular context. Emotional intelligence is a broad subject and this piece breaks it down into some simple points that others can start and adapt from. Much appreciated!

paragraphs.text: Thanks so much for this Karla.

I’ve always struggled to understand these aspects of the candidate before hiring, and that has led to some mistakes. Your outline presents a clear and actionable process that I will certainly be incorporating into my into my interviews going forward!

paragraphs.name: 539a
paragraphs.text: Thanks for the write-up Kara! Funnily enough, I have just become more emotionally intelligent from reading your post :)

paragraphs.name: 6f74
paragraphs.text: Great article & pratical suggestions!

paragraphs.name: 96cb
paragraphs.text: Great article! Very useful for our selective interviews of financial guardians. They need to have more emotional intelligence than average.
